metadata.disclaimer: Based on publicly available crosswalks and expert analysis. Validate with qualified assessors for compliance/audit use.

clauses.title: Identify important business services
clauses.rationale: PM-11 mission/business process; PM-8 critical infrastructure; CP-2 contingency planning identifies critical functions.
clauses.gaps: PRA requires identification of 'important business services' with specific impact tolerances. SP 800-53 covers mission process definition but UK-specific IBS methodology and impact tolerance setting not addressed.

clauses.title: Set impact tolerances for important business services
clauses.rationale: CP-2 includes RTO/RPO which are related concepts; PM-11 mission process definition.
clauses.gaps: Significant gap. PRA impact tolerances are a specific UK regulatory concept measuring maximum tolerable disruption. SP 800-53 uses RTO/RPO which are related but distinct from impact tolerances.

clauses.title: Map important business services
clauses.rationale: PM-11 mission processes; PL-8 security architecture; CM-8 inventory; SA-9 external dependencies.
clauses.gaps: PRA requires mapping of resources (people, technology, facilities, information, third parties) supporting each IBS. SP 800-53 covers system inventory and dependencies but IBS-level resource mapping methodology not addressed.

clauses.title: Scenario testing
clauses.rationale: CP-4 contingency testing; IR-3 incident response testing; PM-14 testing/exercises; CA-8 penetration testing.
clauses.gaps: PRA requires severe but plausible scenario testing against impact tolerances. SP 800-53 covers testing but the specific PRA scenario testing methodology and impact tolerance validation not addressed.

clauses.title: Lessons learned and actions
clauses.rationale: IR-3 post-incident review; CA-5 POA&M for remediation; PM-6 performance measurement.
clauses.gaps: PRA requires continuous improvement from testing to remain within impact tolerances. SP 800-53 covers lessons learned but PRA-specific improvement cycle not addressed.

clauses.title: Outsourcing and third party risk management
clauses.rationale: SA-4 acquisition; SA-9 external services; SR family supply chain.
clauses.gaps: PRA/FCA outsourcing requirements include materiality assessment, intra-group arrangements, and sub-outsourcing chains. SP 800-53 covers vendor management but UK-specific outsourcing regulatory requirements not fully addressed.

clauses.title: Operational resilience
clauses.rationale: CP and IR families cover contingency and incident response.
clauses.gaps: FCA operational resilience extends beyond IT to people, premises, and processes. SP 800-53 focuses on IT/information security. Broader operational resilience framework gaps exist.

clauses.title: Cyber insurance and stress testing
clauses.rationale: PM-9 risk management strategy; RA-3 risk assessment; CP-2 contingency planning.
clauses.gaps: PRA cyber underwriting and stress testing requirements are UK financial regulatory specific. SP 800-53 covers risk management but financial regulatory stress testing not addressed.

clauses.title: Threat intelligence-led penetration testing
clauses.rationale: CA-8 penetration testing; CA-8(1) independent agent; RA-10 threat hunting; PM-16 threat awareness.
clauses.gaps: CBEST requires threat intelligence-led red team testing of critical financial infrastructure. CA-8 covers penetration testing but the specific CBEST methodology and financial sector focus not addressed.

clauses.title: Senior management responsibilities for cyber
clauses.rationale: PM-1 security program; PM-2 senior security role.
clauses.gaps: FCA senior management arrangements require specific accountability under SM&CR. SP 800-53 assigns roles but UK-specific senior manager accountability framework not addressed.
